Baseline T3 instances offer a balance of

Baseline performance of 3 ,000 iops and

for db2 you can scale compute capacity

GB of
RAM you can scale storage on demand or

tabt you can configure storage

non-production instances

replication it does not use native db2
HR
feature apart from having a synchronous

for db2 automation monitors for any

failures and does a fail over to

automatically
as the copy is synchronously replicated
there is no data loss that is recovery
Point objective is zero this failover

automated backups are offloaded from

standby
instance when a failover is initiated

within 1 to 2 minutes this provides
recovery time objective that is RTO of 2
minutes during this 2 minutes fail over
down time RDS identifies the failure
performs crash recovery and also
completes DNS
propagation the database endpoint does
not change as a result of this failover
so applications or clients don't have to

in RDS for
db2 in Broad categories there are two
types of backups automated backups and
database snapshots let's start with
automated backups the automated backup
feature of Amazon audios for db2 enables
point in time recovery for your audios
for db2 in database instance turned on
by default the automated backup feature
of Amazon RDS for db2 will back up your
database and transaction locks RS
automatically creates a storage volume
snapshot of your database instance
backing up the entire database instance
and and not just individual databases
this backup occurs during a daily user
configurable 30 minutes period known as
the backup window RDS uploads
transaction locks for database instances
to Amazon S3 every 5 minutes as part of
this backup this allows you to restore
your database instance to any second
during your retention period up to the
last 5 minutes you enable automated
backups by setting the backup retention
period to a positive non-zero value you
can set up the backup retention period
of a database instance to between 0 and
35 days setting the backup retention
period to zero disables the automated
backup backups automated backups are
deleted automatically once they get
older than the retention window
defined now let us look at what is
database
snapshot database snapshots are user
initiated backups of your instance
stored in Amazon S3 which provides 11
NES of durability and are kept until you
explicitly delete them when you create a
database snapshot you need to identify
which database instance you're going to
back up and then give your database
snapshot a name so that you can restore
from it later the amount of time it
takes to create a database snapshot
varies with the size of your database
since the snapshot includes the entire
storage volume the size of files such as
temporary files also affects the amount
of time it takes to create the snapshot
these snapshots are incremental in
nature as depicted on the slide the
initial snapshot captures all blocks
while subsequent snapshots only capture
Delta blocks in comparison to the
previous snapshot although database
snapshots serve operationally as full
backups you are built only for the
incremental storage usage you can
encrypt the manual snapshots and also
copy them across accounts and regions
these database snapshots serve various
purposes including refreshing your lower
environments such as from production to
non-production they also act as
checkpoints before implementing changes
in the production environment offering a
safety net for reverting back if needed
during
recovery now let us look at snapshot
point in time
restore you can restore your RS for db2
instance either from a database snapshot
or perform a point in time recovery
using automated backups the restore of
snapshot happens always on a different
instance you can create a new database
instance by restoring from a database
snapshot you provide the name of the
database snapshot to restore from and
then provide a name for the new database
instance that is Created from the
restore you can restore your database
instance to any specific time during the
backup retention period creating a new
database instance to restore your
database instance you can use the AWS
console or command line interface that
is CLI to determine the latest
restorable time for RDS for db2 instance
use the AWS console or CLI to look at
the value return in the latest
restorable time field for a particular
database instance the latest restorable
time for a database instance is
typically within 5 minutes of the
current time the restore process and
workflow is automatic and doesn't
require any user intervention once the
restore time is
specified let us look at the cross
region automated backups feature in RDS
for
db2 RDS for db2 supports cross region
automated backups feature which provides
lowcost Disaster Recovery option in
addition to multi that we discussed
earlier for added Disaster Recovery
capability you can configure your RDS
for db2 database instance to
automatically replicate the backups to a
secondary AWS region when backup
replication is configured for a database
instance RDS initiates a cross region
copy of all snapshots and transaction
locks as soon as they are ready on
primary AWS region the backup retention
period for the destination region is
completely independent of the period set
for the source region in case the RDS
for db2 database becomes unavailable on
the primary region customers can restore
the database to a specific point in time
within their backup retention period and
resume operations in the secondary AWS
region let us look at monitoring options
in RDS for
db2 with RDS you get a collection of 15
to 18 monitoring metrics automatically
available to you you can view metrics in
the audios console in the cloudwatch
console or via the cloudwatch apis you
can keep an eye on metrics like CPU
utilization memory storage and latency
metrics can be viewed in individual or
multiple graphs to compare or you can
pull the data collected into your own
monitoring tool RDS also gives you
enhanced monitoring with access to over
50 additional metrics when you enable
enhanced monitoring you can Define the
granularity at which you see the metrics
from 60c all the way up to 1 second
intervals with RS since you do not have
access to the host system enhanced
monitoring gives you the list of
processes threads running at the host
level you can sort it by top consumers
of CPU memory Etc enhanced monitoring
offers deeper insights and performance
metrics compared to basic monitoring
with which you can identify and
troubleshoot performance issues more
effectively you can also use db2 native
monitoring tools to monitor RDS for db2
instance pretty much any tool that can
remotely connect to RDS db2 database and
does not require access to the RDS OS
can be used for example db2 top DSM top
DMC top IBM data management console you
can also monitor RDS for db2 database
with table functions and Stor procedures
along with event
monitors let let us look at security and
compliance in RDS for
db2 cloud security at AWS is the highest
priority as an AWS customer you benefit
from a Data Center and network
architecture that is built to meet the
requirements of the most security
sensitive organizations network security
is offered through VPC with which you
can launch AWS resources in a logically
isolated virtual Network that you have
defined and connect to your existing it
infrastructure using industry standard
encrypted IPC
VPN AWS identity and access management
that is IM am is a web service that
helps you securely control access to AWS
resources RDS for db2 is integrated with
I am service and provides you with the
ability to control the actions that your
AWS am users and groups can take on
specific resources for example database

groups event subscriptions and option
groups in nutshell with IM am you can
centrally manage permissions that

Management Service or KMS you can
encrypt Communications between your
applications and your database instance
using SSL TLS which safeguards the data
and Transit providing comprehensive
protection authentication option include
local users and AWS managed active
directory with
karos RDS for db2 has the same security
features as other RDS engines making
sure your data and applications are well
protected it ensures your data meets AWS
compliance program standards including
Hippa fedramp s so and more audios for
db2 supports auditing for db2
databases when enabled auds for db2
stores the audit logs in S3 bucket to
meet your long-term retention policies
with db2 audit logging AOS for db2
records database activity including
users logging into into the database and
the queries Runs run against the
database the audit log retention in S3
and other auditing categories can be

provide stored procedure that is
configure DB
audit security is a shared
responsibility between AWS and you AWS
is responsible for protecting the
infrastructure that runs AWS services in
the AWS Cloud AWS also provides you with
the services that you can use securely
your responsibility is determined by the
AWS service that you use you're also
responsible for other factors including
the sensitivity of your data your
company's requirements and applicable
laws and
regulations now let us look at migration
options for RDS for
db2 RDS for db2 offers support for
migrations through both the database
migration service or DMS that is AWS
native service and also through db2
native tools you can perform a one-time
migration of your db2 database from
Linux AIS or Windows environments to RDS
for db2 to minimize downtime you can
perform a near zero downtime migration
as well with DMS you have the option for
full load task for onetime migration or
combination of full load plus change
data capture that is CDC task for near
zero downtime migration for onetime
migrations for self-managed Linux based
db2 databases Amazon RDS for db2
supports offline and online
backups we recommend that you use online
backups for a near zero downtime
migrations and offline backups for
migrations that can handle downtime with
the offline backup approach you backup
your self-managed db2 database to an
Amazon S3 bucket then you use Amazon RDS
stored procedures to restore your db2
database to an Amazon RDS for db2
instance with the online backup approach
you take an online backup of your
self-managed Linux based db2 database
and restore it onto the RDS for db2
server with Amazon RDS stored
procedures you then apply subsequent
transaction logs to bring the database
up to date this approach results in
minimal to no outage or downtime for the
application or users this approach backs
up your database and restores it with
log replay which helps prevent
disruptions to ongoing operations and
provides High availability for your
database for migrations from
self-managed non-linux db2 databases
hosted on AIX windows or zos to RS db2
you can utilize native db2 tools which
includes the export utility the db2 move
system command or the db2 look system
command to back up your self-managed db2
database to as to an Amazon S3 bucket
then use a db2 client to load data
directly from the S3 bucket to your RDS
for db2 database using native db2 tools
such as import load and ingest you can
also use tools like IBM cure application
and db2 migration tooling or db2 Mt to
migrate the database into RDS for db2
db2 Mt here eases the migration of

instance and allocated Storage storage
can scale automatically and compute can

you can also stop your RDS for db2

consecutive days while the instance is
stopped you're not charged for DB
instance hours just like other Aus
engines the storage and compute are
